page.title: 19GARTMORE HOUSE - PAST OWNERS
page.content: {Robert Bontine Cunninghame Graham lived in Gartmore House until 1900 and was a well-known author and poet. He travelled in Argentina and Uruguay as "Don Roberto", and he and his black horse, Pampa, were a well loved sight in Gartmore. He died in 1936 and was buried on Inchmahome in the Lake of Menteith. A memorial is erected at the top of the village to him. {The Cayser family}bought Gartmore House in 1900 and lived there until the estate was bought in 1956. Most villagers worked for the estate and bought their houses when the estate was sold. In the Cayser burial ground there is a Moondial set to Gartmore time. Gartmore House was then bought by the{De La Salle order}of teaching brothers who, until 1982, ran a List D school for Roman Catholic boys.
